DOCNAME: CASE OF MANGÎR AND OTHERS v. THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA AND RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment;Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect) (the Republic of Moldova);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment;Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect) (Russia);No violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment) (Substantive aspect) (the Republic of Moldova);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment) (Substantive aspect) (Russia);No violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention) (the Republic of Moldova);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention) (Russia);No violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-3 - Reasonableness of pre-trial detention;Article 5-4 - Review of lawfulness of detention) (the Republic of Moldova);No violation of Article 13+3 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy) (Article 3 - Prohibition of torture;Degrading treatment) (the Republic of Moldova);Violation of Article 13+3 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy) (Article 3 - Prohibition of torture;Degrading treatment) (Russia)
JUDGES: Dmitry Dedov;Jon Fridrik Kjølbro;Nebojša Vučinić;Paul Lemmens;Robert Spano
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , who are police officers , were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively . The first and second applicants live in GPE and PERSON and the remaining applicants live in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE officers PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , who were conducting a criminal investigation in PERSON , were arrested by the secret service of the self - proclaimed “ GPE ” ( “ FAC ) . During their arrest they managed to call the PERSON police station .
CARDINAL . The other CARDINAL applicants ( officers GPE and PERSON ) went to PERSON to clarify the reasons for the arrest of their colleagues , but were also arrested upon their arrival .
CARDINAL . The applicants were placed in FAC ( PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE officers PERSON , GPE and PERSON were released without charge and without any explanation for their arrest .

CARDINAL . On DATE officer PERSON was allegedly beaten up and injected with an unknown substance , which rendered him unconscious for DATE . After his release he was admitted for in - patient treatment in the hospital of ORG of GPE , where he was diagnosedwith , inter alia , concussion .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a warrant for officer PERSON to be detained for DATE . On DATE the “ FAC authorities released officers PERSON and PERSON . The head of the “ FAC secret service declared in an interview that the officers had been released after NORP authorities had “ given assurances ” that GPE authorities would not “ kidnap people ” in the “ FAC .

CARDINAL . The applicants were accused in the “ FAC media of being members of “ black squadrons ” created for the purpose of kidnapping politicians and other persons causing nuisance to the GPE authorities . According to the applicants , during their detention they were questioned by the “ FAC secret service and forced to declare that in PERSON they had been trying to kidnap “ FAC politicians . Officers PERSON , GPE and PERSON were allegedly beaten on the soles of their feet and threatened with the killing of members of their families , as well as with being transferred to cells occupied by common criminals , where they would be ill - treated or even killed .
CARDINAL . Officer PERSON was allegedly subjected to so - called “ NORP hanging ” for TIME and was taken to his cell unconscious thereafter .

CARDINAL . The applicants described as follows their conditions of detention at FAC . The cells in which they had been held had been in the basement and had not had access to natural light . In the absence of ventilation and because of overcrowding it had been difficult to breathe . Officer PERSON submits that he was detained in the same cell as that in which Mr PERSON had been detained ( for more details see ORG and Others v. GPE and GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , ORG CARDINALVII ) .

CARDINAL . During their detention the applicants did not have any DATE exercise and were not given access to a shower ; they could not receive parcels containing food from their relatives , they did not have bed linen and they were not allowed to be seen by doctors .

CARDINAL . After the applicants’ release the NORP authorities initiated CARDINAL sets of criminal proceedings concerning their unlawful detention and their alleged ill - treatment while in detention . However , DATE the investigation was discontinued .

CARDINAL . The applicants were also subjected to medical check - ups , which found no traces of violence on their bodies . CARDINAL applicant , PERSON , was found to be suffering from the consequences of concussion .
